intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum f. transiens, commonly known as the slender valerian, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in specialized gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity and often sought after by horticultural enthusiasts.
